page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: This is a rich area in local history NEOLITHIC:One of the most important neolithic sites so far known in Kent is Baston Manor where more than 200 fragments of pottery together with 2,200 struck flints have been found IRON AGE:An important hillfort is at Holwood,Keston covering an area of 43 acres Nearby at Warbank is a large unenclosed Iron Age settlement and in North Pole Lane a small farmstead. ROMAN:A Roman villa with an extensive estate and a mausoleum are at Warbank,a Roman bath house at Baston Manor and other Romano-British sites in Fox Hill North Pole Lane and Elm Farm. SAXON:At Warbank an Anglo-Saxon sunken hut 440-550 A.D containing pottery,lead loomweight,bronze tweezers and antler tools have been found. NORMAN:Part of Keston Parish Church is Norman.
